seo.metaTitle: NWA Daily - A daily newsletter about all things Northwest Arkansas
seo.metaDescription: NWA Daily is a daily email newsletter that keeps readers up to date on the latest Northwest Arkansas news or NWA news in events, restaurants, business,  the community, politics, art, entertainment, culture, and sports in Northwest Arkansas including news about Bentonville, Rogers, Springdale, and Fayetteville

posts.title: Amplify Your Concert Experience At AMP Underground
posts.content:
New this concert season, the Walmart AMP now offers ticketholders access to AMP Underground, an all-ages club located underneath Choctaw Plaza, including a private bar and limited food menu, lounge seating, live concert video and audio feed, and private restrooms.

  • First in line: The space opens 30 minutes before the main gates, giving priority entry into the venue, and closes one hour after the concert ends.
  • In the club: Tickets to AMP Underground must be purchased in addition to concert tickets and cost $49 per person, which covers access to the club plus two drinks and light snacks included.

Check out the remaining 2023 concert lineup and purchase ticket add-ons HERE.

posts.title: Fayetteville Ale Trail Celebrates 10 Years
posts.content:
Launched by Experience Fayetteville in August 2013, the Fayetteville Ale Trail is approaching its tenth birthday as the essential Northwest Arkansas brewery experience and has printed over 35,000 passports so far!

  • Well traveled: Passports can be picked up at the Experience Fayetteville Visitors Center, at any of the 19 breweries on the Ale Trail, or ordered online. Once the passport has been stamped at each location, it can be turned in for a free prize.
  • A taste of the region: The 19 stops along the Fayetteville Ale Trail provide a glimpse into the unique craft brewery and cidery culture of Northwest Arkansas, including stops in Fayetteville, Springdale, Rogers, Bentonville, Lowell, Eureka Springs, and Siloam Springs.

Order your passport and start your Fayetteville Ale Trail journey HERE.

posts.title: The Razorbacks Begin Their Journey To Omaha
posts.content:
No. 3 national seed Arkansas will begin the road to Omaha from their home field at Baum-Walker Stadium, hosting Santa Clara, TCU, and Arizona for the College World Series regional.

  • Welcome to the SEC: Ten SEC teams made bids for the series, the most of any conference, and a record eight of those ten are hosting regionals, including Arkansas, Alabama, Auburn, Florida, Kentucky, LSU, South Carolina, and Vanderbilt.
  • Up to bat: The Razorbacks will begin their first round against Santa Clara at 2p in front of a sold-out Baum-Walker Stadium, playing a double elimination format over the weekend until one team advances to the 16-team super regional.

Follow along with news on the NCAA Tournament HERE.

posts.title: Weekend Roundup
posts.content:
It's the weekend! Here are a few ideas to get the fun started.

  • üé® Artsy types: It's First Friday in Downtown Bentonville, and the theme is Art Fest ‚Äî a celebration of creativity, engaging all five senses on Jun 2, with events happening on the Square from 11a-9p.
  • üßµ It's called fashion: Interform's inaugural fashion and art biennial ASSEMBLY kicks off this weekend with a Gallery Crawl through Downtown Springdale on Friday, Jun 2, from 6-10p.
  • üìö Let's book it: Fayetteville Public Library will host its Summer Reading Kickoff! including bounce houses, face painting, stilt walkers, bubbles, food, and more on Saturday, Jun 3, from 9:30a-12:30p. 
  • üê∑ Pigsty: Get down and dirty during the 9th Annual Pig Trail Mud Run, a 5K obstacle course in Springdale, on Saturday, Jun 3, at 7a.
  • üöÇ All aboard: The Rogers Historical Museum will host a day of food, crafts, games, model trains, and more during Family Day this Saturday, Jun 3, from 10a-2p.
  • üèì Dam slam: Grab your partner and head to Bentonville's Osage Park for the first-ever Dam Slam pickleball tournament this Saturday and Sunday, Jun 3-4.
  • üõçÔ∏è That's rad: Check out Downtown Rogers' Art District's newest makers market ‚Äî the RAD on 2nd will feature 40+ local artisans and vendors at 718 N. 2nd St. this Sunday, Jun 4, from 10a-4p.
  • üé° Gettin' muddy: Lowell continues its annual Mudtown Days this weekend at Ward Nail Park, including car shows, an ATV mud run, kids' pageants, carnival rides, and pore.
  • üé∏ Blues: Jump into the sound of blues, rock, and funk during The Eureka Springs Blues Party, lasting until Jun 4.
  • üå∏ Just tickled: Pink House Alchemy is celebrating 10 years with a Paint the Town Pink party, including a popup shop with Cheap Thrills, portraits from Happy Aura, and flash tattoos from Paper Doll Tattoo!
  • ü´ê Berry blast: Neal Family Farm in Rogers is open for the blueberry picking season, open Friday and Saturday from 8-11a and 5-8p and on Sunday from 5-8p.
  • üèéÔ∏è Fast & Furious: Drift into the weekend with Reaction Motorsports during a family-friendly racing drifting & autocross event at Drake Field in Fayetteville this Saturday and Sunday, Jun 3-4.

Enjoy your weekend, NWA! We'll see you Monday.

node.headline: You Can Find Me In The Club

posts.title: Local Businesses Represent Ozarks At Smithsonian
posts.content:
Ozark Beer Company, Yeyo's, and Pink House Alchemy will join a select group of representatives in The Ozarks: Faces and Facets of a Region, a program highlighting the Ozarks region of the United States during the 2023 Smithsonian Folklife Festival in Washington D.C. from Jun 29 - Jul 9.

  • Vibrant culture: The Smithsonian Folklife Festival highlights the unique culture of our nation's distinct regions. The Ozark program will feature musicians, dancers, cooks, artisans, storytellers, large-scale murals, a custom-built mountain bike trail, music jam sessions and performances, dance and craft workshops, food demonstrations, and curated discussions. 
  • Called to the capital: Representing the region's entrepreneurship and creative spirit, Ozark Beer Co. will share a curated collection of craft brews at the event's marketplace alongside two other NWA entrepreneurs, Emily Lawson of Pink House Alchemy and Rafael Rios of Yeyo's.

Read more about the program HERE.

posts.title: Pesto Caf√© In Fayetteville Reopens Under New Ownership
posts.content:
After closing in 2022, Fayetteville's iconic Pesto Caf√© has been brought back to life by Chef Lance, and reopened over Memorial Weekend as Pesto's by Lance.

  • Local favorite: Pesto Caf√© originally opened in the late 1990's and became a local staple for Italiain cuisine, serving pasta, pesto, and red sauce in its classic, hole-in-the-wall location adjoined with Chief Motel on College Ave.
  • Meet the chef: For nearly three decades, Chef Lance has honed his culinary skills, holding positions from Sous Chef to Executive Chef and winning several awards. He's excited to revive Pesto Caf√© and share his passion for Classic Italian Cuisine with the vibrant food scene of Fayetteville.

Learn more about Pesto's by Lance HERE.

posts.title: KUAF Celebrates 50 Years Of Public Broadcasting
posts.content:
KUAF 91.3FM has provided 24/7 coverage of invaluable news, information, and culture to people across Northwest Arkansas and the surrounding region for fifty years!

  • Timeless and timely: The radio station began in 1973 as a low-powered radio station on the University of Arkansas campus and has since grown its coverage to a 14-county area, including parts of Arkansas, Oklahoma, and Missouri as the only source of national and international news from NPR as well as a daily local program Ozarks at Large.
  • On the airwaves: KUAF broadcasts various locally produced programs, podcasts, and musical performances that amplify authentic voices on critical issues, share insights from diverse cultures, and create space for meaningful dialogue.

You can support public radio by listening or donating to KUAF 91.3 online HERE.

posts.title: Shop Local At Downtown Rogers Newest Makers Market
posts.content:
Mavis Wine Co. and Java Dudes Coffee Co. have collaborated to bring an exciting new makers market to Downtown Rogers' Art District called the RAD on 2nd, featuring local artisans and vendors at 718 N. 2nd St. this Sunday, Jun 4, from 10a-4p

  • Hosts with the most: Coffee in the morning, wine in the afternoon ‚Äî Java Dudes Coffee Co. will have samples of popular drinks and freshly roasted coffee blends for sale, and Mavis Wine Co., Arkansas's first natural wine bar & bottle shop, will have flights available of their natural, organic, biodynamic, minimal intervention, and sustainable wines.
  • Meet the makers: Stop by Chelle's Burger Joint during the event and enjoy live music while exploring 40+ local vendors as they showcase handmade jewelry, pottery, textiles, and more.

Learn more about RAD on 2nd HERE.

posts.title: The Rise At Coler Mountain Reveals New Meditation Platform
posts.content:
Coler Mountain Bike Preserve has added a large meditation platform and bench seating at the top of The Rise, the 185 step stairway ascending through Coler's beautiful scenery to the Hub at the highest point of the preserve.

  • To the top: Giving walkers and runners a place to rest and appreciate the scenery, the new platform was built by Archadeck and the final 11 steps of the stairway now have motivational phrases carved into the wood surface by Scott Schroen of Timbernak Customs.
  • Getting there: The Rise is located 200 yds north of Airship Coffee at Coler on the east side of the greenway, and can be accessed from any parking lot via the Applegate Trail between SW 8th St and NW 3 rd St.

Follow @ColerMountainBikePreserve on Facebook and Instagram to stay updated on all things happening at The Preserve.

posts.title: Interform's ASSEMBLY Begins With Gallery Crawl
posts.content:
Interform's inaugural fashion and art biennial ASSEMBLY kicks off this weekend with an opening ceremony at The Momentary on Jun 1 and a Gallery Crawl in Downtown Springdale on Jun 2, from 6-10p.

  • Explore fashion: The Gallery Crawl will begin at the Atelier retail pop-up at Famous Hardware and move through eight locations in Downtown Springdale, including several unique exhibitions like a cake performance, live music, and more. Tickets are $23 and include a commemorative cup and a wine pour at each venue.
  • All month long: Intended to amplify the expression of art, fashion, and community, ASSEMBLY will be a month-long immersive experience involving art installations, exhibits, retail pop-ups, and three evenings of runway shows during NWA Fashion Week.

Reserve tickets for the Gallery Crawl and NWA Fashion Week HERE.

posts.title: Rogers Historical Museum Hosts Family Day
posts.content:
The Rogers Historical Museum will host a day of food, crafts, games, and more during Family Day this Saturday, Jun 3, from 10a-2

  • Fun-filled: Enjoy family-friendly activities like face painting, Butterfly Park tours, blacksmith demonstrations, woodcarving, food trucks, crafts, a quilt show, and a model train display by the caboose in Downtown Rogers.
  • On parade: In conjunction with our current exhibit, A Parade of Apple Blossoms, there will be a Family Day parade around Downtown Rogers at 1:30p, and all kids and families are welcome to make a fun parade craft and join in the lineup.

Find more information about Rogers Historical Museum HERE.

posts.title: Bentonville's June First Friday Theme Is Art Fest
posts.content:
Bentonville's June First Friday theme is Art Fest, a celebration of creativity sure to engage all five senses on Jun 2, with events happening at the Bentonville Square from 11a-9p.

  • Creative spaces: Leatherworking, homemade soaps, instruments, painters, jewelry, henna, and more; there will be a multitude of artistic expressions to explore throughout Downtown Bentonville during this First Friday celebration. Don't forget the Schmieding Family Sensory Alley is available for those who may find First Friday overstimulating.
  • Let's get it started: Food trucks will open at 11a for lunch, and the rest of First Friday will run from 3-9p. The DJ lineup includes M. Bolez at 5p, Allen.MP3 at 6p, and headliner DJ Afrosia on stage from 7-9p.

Read more about what to expect at June First Friday HERE.

posts.title: Hark Connects Community With Summer Childcare & Jobs Opportunities
posts.content:
Many families and individuals experience an increased need for childcare and temporary employment opportunities throughout the summer months. Hark can connect you with local organizations that provide these needed resources.

  • Job well done: Arkansas Joblink is an easy-to-use resource where employers post open positions in our region; similarly, Careers NWA has job postings specifically for students, employees, employers, and educators.
  • Schools out: Boys & Girls Clubs across Benton County still have availability in their summer programs for children ages 6-18 at the Bentonville, Rogers, Bella Vista, and Pea Ridge locations. Also, the Rogers Activity Center accepts DHS vouchers for its 1st - 7th-grade programs.

If you aren't sure where to start or need help navigating what's right for you and your family, connect with a Hark Community Liaison who can help HERE.
posts.topic: Sponsored by Hark at Excellerate Foundation

posts.title: Picklemall Announces Plans For Bentonville Location
posts.content:
Picklemall, an indoor pickleball concept that reuses existing indoor mall and strip mall properties, has announced plans to open a facility in Bentonville ‚Äî one of 50 markets where the brand plans to expand over the next two years.

  • On camera: Players can utilize the Picklemall app to schedule games, and sessions will be recorded by a camera in the facility, giving players the ability to watch and analyze their game footage in real-time on the app.
  • First serve: A specific date and location have not been set for Bentonville, but the first Picklemall will open in Tempe, Arizona this July. Other markets targeted for expansion include Minneapolis, Chicago, Milwaukee, Austin, Dallas, San Antonio, Oklahoma City, and Tulsa.

Read more on Arkansas Business HERE.

posts.title: #NWAChampionship & BITE Experience Tickets Go On Sale Jun 6
posts.content:
The Walmart #NWAChampionship presented by P&G will bring 144 of the world‚Äôs best female golfers to Pinnacle Country Club in Rogers to compete for a $2.3m purse this fall, Sep 23 ‚Äì Oct 1, as well as an exciting lineup of community events, including a 5k race, food festival, guided bike rides, and more.

  • Local flavors: The tournament‚Äôs onsite food festival, BITE Experience @ the LPGA, will return as part of the #NWAChampionship, from Sep 29 until Oct 1, with each day featuring a culinary experience that highlights a variety of diverse-owned local restaurants and eateries.
  • For a run: The 5k @ the LPGA benefiting Mercy will return to the Walmart AMP on Saturday, Sep 23, and local companies are encouraged to participate in the corporate challenge for the title of Fittest and Fastest Office in NWA‚Äîmore race information to come.

Over 750 volunteers are needed to make #NWAChampionship Week possible. Volunteer registration and ticket sales open next Tuesday, Jun 6.

posts.title: It's Time For Mudtown Days In Lowell
posts.content:
A 45-year tradition, Lowell will host its annual Mudtown Days at Ward Nail Park, including car shows, an ATV mud run, kids pageants, and plenty more to enjoy, and a carnival from May 31 to Jun 3.

  • Get muddy: Watch ATV drivers sling mud, explore hotrods during the Mudtown Days Car Show, and enjoy food trucks and free live music by Mark Wills on Jun 2 and Heath Sanders and Pam Tillis on Jun 3.
  • Family fun: There will be fun for the whole family to enjoy, along with prizes to be won, carnival rides, inflatables and games, and contests to enter, like a mud run, fishing derby, and Little Mr. and Miss Lowell and Tiny Tots Pageants.

Learn more about Mudtown Days HERE.

posts.title: Community Created and Community Driven Sustainability
posts.content:
There's a better way to dispose of all those leftover food scraps from your Memorial Day cookout. Ozark Compost's convenient compost pickup is driving positive environmental impacts and has already diverted over 80,000 lbs of food waste from Northwest Arkansas's landfills.

  • Convenient composting: With easy-to-follow compost guides, customer support, and text notifications, composting could not be easier. Fill your 5-gal bucket with compostable items, and OCS will pick it up and deliver a clean one weekly or bi-weekly. You can even receive givebacks for garden use.
  • Conscious consumption: Include a ground or whole-bean Airship coffee subscription with your deliveries, and shop other eco-friendly, zero-waste products on Ozark Compost's online store.

The first 10 NWA Daily readers to sign up will receive a free month of bi-weekly pickups and a refillable coffee canister if you add a coffee subscription, Use code OCS2023 or click HERE.

posts.title: ArDOT Discusses New Highway Through NWA
posts.content:
The Arkansas Department of Transportation has released preliminary findings of the Western North-South Connector Study and will host public involvement meetings to further the proposal to add a north-south highway corridor through western Benton County.

  • Making connections: The plan would likely utilize existing roadways, upgrading smaller roads and connecting segments to create a continuous route for safe and efficient north-south bound travel between the growing communities of Gravette, Centerton, Bentonville, Highfill, and Tontitown.
  • Public input: There are currently no state funds available nor state projects planned for this corridor in the near future. However, information gathered from the public involvement meetings on Jun 5-7 will guide future planning and coordination with local communities.

Find more information and a short video explaining the project HERE.

posts.title: Get Your 80's-90's Vibes On During Fayetteville's First Thursday
posts.content:
Unleash all of your 80‚Äôs & 90‚Äôs nostalgia during Fayetteville‚Äòs ‚ÄúThrow Back Thursday‚Äù themed First Thursday on Jun 1 at the Downtown Square from 5:30-9p.

  • We Built This City: First Thursday on the Square is an annual event series by Experience Fayetteville intended to gather the community around the combination of music, food, art, and fun! This month's presenting sponsor is CACHE.
  • Gettin Jiggy Wit It: The arts and music celebration will include a diverse lineup of art installations, a vintage market, food trucks, a Slow Roll group bike ride with Trailblazers & Bike Fayetteville, and live music from School of Rock, The Juice, and Ultra Suede.

Find all the details for June‚Äôs First Thursday HERE.

posts.title: May Sales Tax Revenue Up 8.9% In Northwest Arkansas
posts.content:
Northwest Arkansas saw an 8.89% increase in sales tax revenue for May 2023 compared to May 2022, for a combined revenue of $9.664m. Year-to-date totals have climbed to $45.612m, up 11.31% from the same period last year.

  • May flowers: Bentonville led the pack for May gains, posting a 20.48% gain in sales tax revenue at nearly $2.54m. Rogers reported the second-highest gains, bringing in $2.234m, up 7.5% from last year.
  • Bigger picture: Fayetteville experienced a 7.37% increase in growth and brought in $2.692m during the month of May. Springdale had a fairly flat month, growing just .14% over a year ago, but this year, it earned a sales tax revenue of $9.669m, up 8.21% from a year ago.

Read more on the story from TB&P HERE.

posts.title: Weekend Roundup
posts.content:
Happy Memorial Day Weekend, Northwest Arkansas! Here are a few fun things going on in the area...

  • Let's ride: Pedal on over to Ole Applegate Place, just south of Coler Mountain Bike Preserve, and catch the last days of Bentonville Bike Fest!
  • Summah time! The Johnson Square Summer Series kicks off this Friday, May 27, filling the streets with games, giveaways, and live music from 6-9p.
  • Groove with me: Settle into the sweet vibes of reggae fusion group Rochelle Bradshaw & Hypnotion at Butterfield Stage in Rogers on Friday, May 26, at 7:30p.
  • New party: Siloam Springs will host its first-ever Fourth Friday community event at Memorial Park on May 26, from 4-8:30p, and the theme is Americana!
  • Oink: The sound of blues and the smell of barbecue will fill the air in historic Downtown Rogers as Pig Gig Arkansas returns to Butterfield Stage this Saturday, May 27, from 5-10p.
  • Ferris wheels: Enjoy rides, games, and food concessions during the Spring Carnival at Parsons Stadium in Springdale until May 29.
  • Salud: Tacos and beer... Enough said. Swing by Ozark Beer Company in Rogers for the first-ever Taco Festival this Sunday, May 28, from 12-5p.
  • Constructive play: The Amazeum opens its exciting new Building Buddies exhibition at noon this Saturday, May 27, which invites children to experience building and construction through play.
  • Haven't you heard: It's the last weekend to explore the Listening Forest at Crystal Bridges before it closes for the summer months on May 28.
  • Arigat≈ç: The Botanical Garden of the Ozarks will host a Japanese Matcha Tasting workshop on Sunday, May 28, from 2-4p, guiding guests through a journey of traditional Japanese culture.
  • Batter up: Watch the Razorbacks in the SEC Tournament semifinals on Saturday, May 27, at noon against the winner of today's matchup between LSU and 10-seed Texas A&M.

Enjoy the long weekend! We'll be back in your inbox on Tuesday.

posts.title: YT Industries Plans Experience Center For Bentonville
posts.content:
YT Industries has plans to open a YT MILL in Downtown Bentonville, an immersive 2-floor showroom and event venue set to open by Spring 2024.

  • Elevated experience: Beyond showcasing the entire range of YT mountain bikes, the YT Mill will host entertainment and community events and serve beverages in a rider‚Äôs lounge area, and provide a pro-level workshop where YT customers can have their bikes built, set up, and serviced onsite.
  • One of a kind: The Bentonville YT MILL will be the second U.S. location opened after San Clemente, CA. Other YT MILL locations worldwide are located in Surrey Hills, United Kingdom, and Hausen, Germany.

Read more about the new YT Industries HERE.

posts.title: XNA Shares Preview Of Terminal Modernization Project
posts.content:
Northwest Arkansas National Airport shared a sneak peek of what's to come from the $34m terminal modernization project, which began earlier this year.

  • Taking off: Keeping up with the rapid growth of the region, the renovation will modernize the airport with new baggage-handling equipment, information desks, and flight information displays to new flooring, lighting, and a canopy over the drop-off area.
  • Cruising altitude: The project broke ground in March, and crews are busy at work on the various pieces of the renovation. All in all, the project is estimated to take over two years to complete.

View more project renderings on XNA's Facebook HERE.
